newsitem.title: UK: Amersham confirms Pharmacia Biotech talks
newsitem.headline: Amersham confirms Pharmacia Biotech talks

text.p: British science and technology group Amersham International Plc said on Friday that it was in talks with Pharmacia & Upjohn Inc on the possible merger of its life sciences division with Pharmacia Biotech.

The company rushed out a statement after Swedish press reports that it had conducted a due diligence investigation of the Swedish-based Biotech pushed its share price to record levels in morning trading.
The company said it "confirms that it is in discussions with Pharmacia & Upjohn which may lead to a merger of the two life sciences businesses".
Amersham, which reports full-year results on June 10, said it would make a further announcement "should this become appropriate".
There has been speculation that Amersham Life Science and Pharmacia Biotech, which both specialise in supplying complex drug testing and development technology, could be merged into a single company.
Pharmacia Biotech had total sales of $439 million last year, although the figure was inflated by sales from medical instruments group Biacore which has since been spun off.
Amersham's Life Science operation had total sales of 157.1 million stg in the year to March 1996, representing around 44 percent of group sales.
